ygData.msgSnippet: Hello David, I successfully installed Cantera 1.7.1 on suse 10.2 both 32 and 64 bit. At the moment I have checked only the matlab demo. Some problems: 1. I was

Hello David,
I successfully installed Cantera 1.7.1 on suse 10.2 both 32 an=
d 64
bit. At the moment I have checked only the matlab demo. 
Some problems=
:
1. I was need to turn off "boost" option. They was on in CVS version
whic=
h I downloaded today. In spite that I have boost instaled it gaves
the foll=
owing error:

g++ -pthread -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.5/src/pycanter=
a.o
-L/home/sergey/src/cantera171/cantera/build/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gn=
u
-L/usr/lib64 -L/home/sergey/sundials/lib -L/usr/local/lib
-L/usr/lib/pyth=
on2.5/config -lclib -luser -loneD -lzeroD -lequil
-lkinetics -ltransport -l=
thermo -lctnumerics -lsundials_cvodes
-lsundials_nvecserial -lctbase -llapa=
ck -lblas -lctmath -ltpx -lctf2c
-lconverters -lboost_thread-mt-1_34 -lctf2=
c -lctf2c -lm -lpython2.5 -o
build/lib.linux-x86_64-2.5/Cantera/_cantera.so=

/usr/lib64/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/4.1.2/../../../../x86_64-suse-linux/bin/l=
d:
cannot find -lboost_thread-mt-1_34
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status

=
2. It is possible to compile only with f2c option. Using g77 or
gfortran  g=
ives undefined symbols: printstring_ for g77
or_gfortran_stop_numeric. 

3.=
 Problem with f2c was in the 64 bit version: I was needed to add
manually -=
fPIC in CFLAGS in all makefiles in etc subdirectories:
f2c_math, f2c_lapack=
, etc. There is probably the better way to do it.
But after this change all=
 is working.

Regards
Sergey.



--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Good=
win <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> Cantera 1.7.1 is ready to be checked out from=
 CVS for unix/linux/Mac  
> users. It is probably best to check out a fresh=
 working copy, rather  
> than update an existing one. The new features are=
:
> 
> 1. Thread safe build option.  Cantera can optionally be built to be =
 
> thread safe, which insures that static data (e.g. cached error  
> mess=
ages) are modified by only one thread at a time. This option  
> requires t=
he Boost thread library (which is why it is not the  
> default).  You can =
download Boost from www.boost.org.
> 
> 2. Faster chemical equilibrium. The=
 equilibrium routines were  
> spending quite a bit of time writing detaile=
d logfiles. Now this can  
> be turned off, or completely compiled out of t=
he code.
> 
> Both of these options may be set in the preconfig script. Ple=
ase  
> report any build problems with this new version.
>
